result.execSummary:
The defendant Mia L Haines was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 0 Days.
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Waukesha County Case #15CF149.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution:  $1,003.42 to the following:  $495.00 to Kohls in Case #15CM459; $430.44 to Pick N Save in Case #15CM460; and $77.98 to Pick N Save in Case #15CM461.

To be paid as a Condition of Probattion.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $50.00 per month starting the Third month of Probation.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Within the First 90 days obtain a valid driver's license.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
No contact with Pick N Save or Kohls in Waukesha County


Cases:  #15CM460 and #15CM461 were Dismissed and Read into Cases:  #15CF149 and #15CM459.

Attorney Masnica motions that this is an illegal sentence.  Argument by the State.
Court denies the motion at this time.  Attorney Masinica to file a motion within 10 days and the State to respond10 days after.
Court will issue a written decision.

Judge Bohren will keep the case for purposes of a decision on the motion only.

records.addlTxt: dated 7/24/15 filed by DOC; requesting that the JOC be amended
dated 7/22/15 filed by Attorney Osborne; regarding the sentence of Ms. Haines
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Mia L Haines in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

1 Year 6 months  Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )  CONSECUTIVE TO 15CF149
- 1 Year of Initial Confinement
- 6 months of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 2 Years  CONSECUTIVE TO 15CF149

Conditions of Probation:
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- WIthin the first 90 days obtain a valid driver's license;
- Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
- No contact with Pick N Save or Kohls in Waukesha County.

Restitution: $1,003.42 ($495.00 to Kohls in 15CM459, $430.44 to Pick N Save in 15CM460 and $77.98 to Pick N Save in 15CM461)  (to be paid ##)

Costs: $253.00 
(To be paid at the rate of $50.00  per month commencing the 3rd month of probation)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Atty. Masnica motions that this is an illegal sentence.  Argument by the State.  
Court denies the motion at this time. Atty. Masnica to file a motion within 10 days and the State to respond within 10 days after.  Court will issue a written decision.

Judge Bohren will keep the case for purposes of a decision on the motion only.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 15, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Mia L Haines in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Masnica requests a plea and sentence date.  Defendant to remain in Waukesha County jail.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Per Taycheedah they cannot place a detainer on defendant's who are serving an ATR.
Per Agent Sara Castillo defendant will start her ATR on 8-10-15 and will be moved from WCJ to TCI on 8-5-15.
Detainer placed at Taycheedah
Hearing on June 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.

SIGNATURE BOND TO TAKE EFFECT WHEN THE DOC AGENT PICKS DEFENDANT UP TO GO TO TAYCHEEDAH.   Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint including any Pick and Save and Kohls.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Follow all rules and requirements of the Alternative to Revocation.  WHEN THE DEFENDANT IS RELEASED FROM TAYCHEEDAH THE BAIL IS TO REVERT BACK TO CASH BAIL PREVIOUSLY SET.

Defendant Mia L Haines in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail argument by Atty. Masnica.  State does not object.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on April 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
to modify bail filed by Attorney Masnica.
